==Japanese==
{{ja-kanjitab|てん|じん|yomi=o}}

===Etymology 1===
From {{etyl|zhx|ja|sort=てんじん}} {{m|zh|sc=Hani|天神}}. Date of borrowing unknown. Compare modern {{cog|cmn|天神|tr=tiānshén||god, godhead, divinity}}.

====Pronunciation====
* {{l|ja|sc=Latn|音読み|On'yomi}}: {{l|ja|sc=Latn|呉音|Go'on}}
* {{ja-accent-common|h|て|んじん}}<ref name="NHK">{{R:NHK Hatsuon}}</ref>
* {{IPA|lang=ja|[tẽ̞ɴd͡ʑĩɴ]}}

=====Usage notes=====
Less commonly read using the {{l|ja|sc=Latn|漢音|''kan'on''}} reading ''tenshin'': {{IPAchar|[tẽ̞ɴɕĩɴ]}}<ref name="KDJ">{{R:Kokugo Dai Jiten}}</ref><ref name="DJR">{{R:Daijirin}}</ref>

====Noun====
[[File:Umeboshi_20101209_b.jpg|thumb|120px|{{lang|ja|天神}}: an [[umeboshi]]]]
[[File:Nihongami_7.jpg|thumb|120px|{{lang|ja|天神}}: the hairstyle]]
{{ja-noun|てんじん|rom=Tenjin}}

# {{lb|ja|sort=てんじん|mythology|Shinto}}: the Japanese gods of the [[heavens]]
# a [[noble]] wearing [[ordinary]] [[robe]]s (robes not [[dye]]d to match the wearer's [[rank]])
# an [[umeboshi]] {{qualifier|from the way that Sugawara no Michizane (see '''Proper noun''' below) was very fond of [[ume]]}}
# an umeboshi [[pit]]
# short for {{m|ja|天神髷|tr=tenjin mage}} or {{m|ja|天神結び|tr=tenjin musubi}}, a certain kind of [[bow]]-shaped [[topknot]] or [[bun]] [[hairstyle]] worn by women, popular in the late 1800s

=====Synonyms=====
* {{sense|gods}} {{ja-l|天つ神|あまつかみ|ama tsu kami}}
* {{sense|umeboshi}} {{ja-l|梅干し|うめぼし|umeboshi}}
* {{sense|hairstyle}} {{ja-l|天神髷|てんじんまげ|tenjin mage}}
* {{sense|hairstyle}} {{ja-l|天神結び|てんじんむすび|tenjin musubi}}

=====Derived terms=====
{{der-top}}
* {{ja-l|天神地祇|てんじんちぎ|tenjin chigi}}: all the gods of [[heaven]] and [[earth]]
* {{ja-l|天神七代|てんじんしちだい|Tenjin Shichidai}}: the seven [[generation]]s of [[gods]] in [[Shintō]] [[mythology]]
{{der-bottom}}

====Proper noun====
[[File:Sugawara_Michizane.jpg|thumb|120px|{{lang|ja|天神}}: Sugawara no Michizane]]
[[File:Kitano-tenmangu_Kyoto_Japan41s3s4592.jpg|thumb|120px|{{lang|ja|天神}}: Tenjin-san, the Tenman-gū shrine to Sugawara no Michizane in Kitano]]
[[File:Tenjinv2.jpg|thumb|120px|{{lang|ja|天神}}: Tenjin Station in downtown Fukuoka]]
{{ja-pos|proper|てんじん}}

# the [[Shinto]] [[kami]] of [[scholarship]], the [[deification]] of {{w|Sugawara no Michizane}} (845-903 CE), a [[scholar]], [[poet]], and [[politician]]
# a [[shrine]] dedicated to {{w|Sugawara no Michizane}}
# one of the traditional [[Noh]] masks, depicting one of the {{m|ja|鬼神|tr=onigami; kijin||fierce gods}} as the [[vengeful]] [[spirit]] of {{w|Sugawara no Michizane}}, the lead role in the {{m|ja|雷電|tr=Raiden}} piece
# an area in [[downtown]] [[Fukuoka]]

=====Synonyms=====
* {{sense|shrine}} {{ja-l|天満宮|てんまんぐう|Tenman-gū}}

=====Derived terms=====
{{der-top}}
* {{ja-l|天神ぞ|てんじんぞ|Tenjin zo}}: (''archaic'') [[for sure]], for [[certain]], [[absolutely]], [[definitely]]
* {{ja-l|天神講|てんじんこう|Tenjin Kō}}: a [[matsuri]] celebrating Sugawara no Michizane, held on the date of his death, 25 February (or on the 25th of every month)
* {{ja-l|天神祭|てんじんまつり|Tenjin Matsuri}}: a [[matsuri]] celebrating Sugawara no Michizane, held on the date of his death, 25 February (or on the 25th of every month)
* {{ja-l|天神橋|てんじんばし|Tenjin-bashi}}: a [[bridge]] over the [[Yodo River]] in [[Ōsaka]]
* {{ja-l|天神髭|てんじんひげ|Tenjin hige}}: a [[beard]] of the style shown in [[depiction]]s of Sugawara no Michizane
* {{ja-l|天神山|てんじんやま|Tenjin Yama}}: the name of various mountains and other places around Japan
* {{ja-l|天神山古墳|てんじんやまこふん|Tenjin Yama Kofun}}: a late-fourth-century [[kofun]] [[tomb]] in {{w|Gunma prefecture}}
{{der-bottom}}

===Etymology 2===
Phrase consisting of {{compound|lang=ja|sort=あまつかみ|天|tr1=ama|t1=the heavens|つ|tr2=tsu|pos2={{etyl|ojp|-}} possessive particle|神|tr3=kami|t3=god, gods}}.<ref name="KDJ">{{R:Kokugo Dai Jiten}}</ref><ref name="DJR">{{R:Daijirin}}</ref>

More commonly written with the ''tsu'' explicitly spelled out in hiragana, as {{ja-l|天つ神}}.

====Pronunciation====
* {{l|ja|sc=Latn|訓読み|Kun'yomi}}
* {{IPA|lang=ja|[a̠ma̠ t͡sɯᵝ ka̠mi]}}

====Alternative forms====
* {{ja-l|天つ神}}, {{ja-l|天津神}}

====Noun====
{{ja-noun|あま つ かみ}}

# {{lb|ja|sort=あまつかみ|mythology|Shinto}}: the Japanese gods of the [[heavens]]

=====Coordinate terms=====
{{der-top|Coordinate terms}}
* {{ja-l|国つ神|くにつかみ|kuni tsu kami}}: the Japanese gods of the [[earth]]
* {{ja-l|天神地祇|てんじんちぎ|tenjin chigi}}: all the gods of [[heaven]] and [[earth]]
{{der-bottom}}

=====External links=====
* {{pedia|lang=ja|天津神・国津神|天津神・国津神 (Ama tsu kami, kuni tsu kami)}} Gives an overview of both groups.
* {{pedia|List_of_divinities_in_Japanese_mythology#Shinto|List_of_divinities_in_Japanese_mythology#Shinto}} Does not distinguish between ''ama tsu kami'' and ''kuni tsu kami''.
